titleInfo.title: Charles de Rabars to Auguste Doussan, 1831 Jan. 7

mods.abstract: Charles de Rabars, Bordeaux, to Auguste Doussan, Rue du Cloître Saint Benoît, Paris. Charles de Rabars, a resident of the Bordeaux region of France, served in Napoleon's army with Antoine Doussan. De Rabars also maintained a lengthy correspondence with Auguste Doussan, a relationship initiated at Antoine Doussan's behest. Auguste Doussan was the younger brother of Antoine Doussan. He practiced medicine in Grasse, France, and married Louise Perrin, who was a relative of the Allain family of Louisiana.De Rabars reports that people have been suffering from political events and financial reversals and reports that he will be spending time near Libourne while recovering from an illness. De Rabars writes of his desire for Auguste to visit him in the country before the latter goes to New England and reports that Antoine, referred to as 'l'Américain', has not been writing him.
mods.note: Bordeaux, January 7, 1831, Charles de Rabars to Auguste Doussan, Rue du Cloître Saint Benoît, Paris. De Rabars mentions that people have been suffering from political events and financial reversals. He is going to spend time in the country near Libourne after having been ill and will keep an apartment in town for the sake of his children. He wants Auguste to visit him in the country before the latter goes to New England. De Rabars complains about Auguste's brother ('l'Américain') for not writing.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Doussan Family Papers, Mss. 4800, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
